com.brawlbots

Class Bot

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.brawlbots.Bot
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BadgerBot, BlasterBot, GeneticBot, IdleBot, MankeBot1000, PlayerControlledBot, ScriptBot, SimpleBot, SniperBot

    public abstract class Bot
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a Bot to play a game of BrawlBots. To create a Bot which is actually capable of playing the game, extend this class. To see some examples, see com.brawlbots.bots.SimpleBot and the likes to get an idea of how the implementation works. Basically, you need to implement the method body to the method updateBot(). It needs to return a BotAction-Double which represents some action a bot can perform, which includes: x Should it accelerate, decelerate? x Should it rotate - if so, which direction? x Should the bot be shooting? This class also introduces some auxillary helping methods to aid Bot-developrs, which includes but is not limited to: x getPosition() x getRotation() x ...
    Author:
    nikol

      • linkArena

        public final void linkArena(Arena a)
        Links this bot to an arena, which basically consists of spawning the spawn.
        Parameters:
        a - The Arena

      • reset

        public final void reset()
        Respawns the bot within the arena. Will throw NullPointerException if arena is not linked.

      • updateBot

        public abstract BotAction updateBot()
        This command is meant to be an update to the bot. No changes can be made directly to the local variables, instead a BotAction Double must be returned. The Bot-framework will handle moving the bots (changing private field variables).
        Returns:

      • hurt

        public abstract void hurt()
        This command is called whenever the bot is hurt. This may be relevant if the strategy changes after the bot has lost some health.

      • ammo

        public abstract void ammo(int id)
        This command is called whenever the bot picks up some ammo.

      • damageBot

        public final boolean damageBot(int arenaKey)
        Damages this bot (ie. when a bullet hits). Note: This method will *not* do anything if arenaKey is not correct (which is a private inaccessible field variable within Arena)
        Parameters:
        arenaKey - The secret key of the arena (no cheating).
        Returns:
